text: In a hybrid compliance uplift in medical devices where automation coverage is low and an audit is scheduled, what should the project manager do to determine quality standards for deliverables?

options.label: review regulatory, customer, and organizational quality requirements
copy the previous project's quality bar without review
choose the cheapest testing approach regardless of risk
skip defining standards until testing starts

explanation: Option a is correct because standards must reflect required criteria. Option b is incorrect because different projects need tailored standards. Option c is incorrect because quality approaches should match risk. Option d is incorrect because late definitions cause rework.

text: Given a outsourced data platform in ecommerce where customers reported usability issues and a release cutover is near, which action best supports determine quality standards for deliverables?

options.label: assume vendors will ensure quality on their own
define acceptance criteria with stakeholders
set standards verbally without documentation
copy the previous project's quality bar without review

explanation: Option b is correct because clear acceptance criteria set the bar for quality. Option a is incorrect because quality ownership must be explicit. Option c is incorrect because undocumented standards lead to inconsistency. Option d is incorrect because different projects need tailored standards.

text: While facing a agile mobile app in pharma where automation coverage is low and lead testers are new to the domain, what is the most effective next step to determine quality standards for deliverables?

options.label: choose the cheapest testing approach regardless of risk
skip defining standards until testing starts
align testing and validation methods to the standards
assume vendors will ensure quality on their own

explanation: Option c is correct because methods must match the expected quality level. Option a is incorrect because quality approaches should match risk. Option b is incorrect because late definitions cause rework. Option d is incorrect because quality ownership must be explicit.

text: For a agile billing system in defense where customers reported usability issues and lead testers are new to the domain, what should the project manager do first to determine quality standards for deliverables?

options.label: set standards verbally without documentation
copy the previous project's quality bar without review
choose the cheapest testing approach regardless of risk
engage QA and domain experts when setting thresholds

explanation: Option d is correct because expert input strengthens standards. Option a is incorrect because undocumented standards lead to inconsistency. Option b is incorrect because different projects need tailored standards. Option c is incorrect because quality approaches should match risk.

text: In a vendor-led analytics product in defense where regulators expect evidence and production defects are escalating, what should the project manager do to determine quality standards for deliverables?

options.label: document quality metrics and tolerances
skip defining standards until testing starts
assume vendors will ensure quality on their own
set standards verbally without documentation

explanation: Option a is correct because metrics make standards measurable. Option b is incorrect because late definitions cause rework. Option c is incorrect because quality ownership must be explicit. Option d is incorrect because undocumented standards lead to inconsistency.
